title: Eco-Innovera and Eco-Pol: What is in it for Slovenia?

author: Robbert Droop, Ministry of Infrastructure and the Environment, The Netherlands

segmentation: We have Heard's interesting stories about how business can do business better.
And resource efficient's and close the loop.
But it's not only business who has to rethink its role, it's also government who has to rethink this role.
And that is what I will try to tell you something about.
I don't know about how it is in Slovenia or other countries that you're coming from, but in the Netherlands at least.
We are abiding by the status quo of environmental regulations at the European level.
And nothing more, because regulations they are bad for business.
That's at least the opinion of the Netherlands government.
So what brings equal innovation about if we don't impose regulations?
We have to tease them.
We have to please industry.
We have to tell them that there are interesting possibilities and that is.
This kind of initiatives that are good cases that the other speaker was was telling about in industry.
We need to tell what are options and that is changing role for government and that is what makes it so important.
And then of course the equal Didi, Didi.
European level is only one of ways for governments to duties and to please and to bring industry.
Two resources efficiency and equal innovative.
Approaches you have seen this giant slide an I will skip it very quickly because Mariana was was telling you about this.
Of course is only one indicator for the material productivity and for the level of economy.
Only one indicator, but maybe this slide is a little bit also an indicator.
This is also from the European Environment Agency and it's about recycling and the level the light green is.
The amount of waste stored, the percentage of waste is being landfilled and over and above the light.
Green is the percentage of waste that is being recycled now.
This includes also recycling by energy recovery, which you can argue.
Fair argue that that is not really good recycling that's downcycling, but anyhow, landfilling is not making use of waste materials at all, so that's real waste in economic terms also.
And there you see that in many countries there is a lot of possibility, so I wanted to share that.
With you before going to further, there is one more.
That I want to share with you, and that is the Eurobarometer.
Its European Commission initiative to ask smaller, medium sized enterprises.
What do you expect for the near future?
And then you see that 75% of the business is actually experienced cost raises, and at 90% of the businesses see this happening within the very near future.
And that is very reason for concern because it's 50% of the economy of the company's cost is material costs, so it's good business to be to try to be more resource efficient.
It's a driver for already 50% of Smas in Europe.
Two to introduce echo on effective approaches and 40% of these SMS.
Having done so actually reported reduced material use of up to 20, sometimes 30 or 40% even material, and you can also add up to the energy level to that, so it's a serious.
Efforts for reducing environmental impacts in energy and in.
And in materials and what's real, point of concern is of course that 70% of SMS are looking for the right partners.
They don't know where to get the expertise.
They don't have the capacities and sometimes not the finance either.
So.
A few examples from the Netherlands you have seen already and I will.
I will not go into that for now, but there is this good business examples.
They're out there.
Lots of experiences.
They're out there.
Ann and Jane action.
Just work, it makes good business.

It requires a whole set of new incentive interventions from government, not only business that can do something in the sector and in the chain of value, but it is also at the level of government that needs to change his role.
His level of interventions, mobilize, facilitate, moderate, bring moderate, bring departments together and inform.
Now that is what echo Innovera is one step in.
It is and cooperation of 25 partners from 20 regions and Slovenia is in it with the Ministry of Science and Technology.
It's currently project funded by the European Commission, but we will be working to lasting.
Operation.
Its focus is research for.
For resource efficiency for equal innovation and one of its major interventions is of course joins or transnational funding.
That's what an error that is for.
But we also want to do to contribute to this implementation of the best findings in business in national.
Elements.
This is a slide.

I will not go through it with you at in detail, but it is the first call for this transnational funding and you see that we aim for encouraging lifecycle thinking and we actually have received a number of proposals where we're currently assessing, so we cannot tell you the final results, but busy.
Is interested.
This is.
The.

Maybe that uniting strategy that that we are offering to governments in the sense of a common understanding of what is equal innovation and building and coordination of national programs and understanding of the capabilities that are out there in government and industry.
Aimed at the incremental and radical changes.
That are possible in sector level or in materials level.
A number of other outputs.
I will not mention them all because we're short of time, I understand, but it is we're doing on.
I want to mention one that's equal innovation parks because that is industrial symbiosis.
We're working on that bringing industries together and establish a self sustaining network for golf.
And for industries.
It's an open invitation for you to participate.
To contribute you take a look at the website and take a look at the LinkedIn.
Groped I was asked also to tell you about equal?
It's another network.
And we are not set in ministry.
We're not even participating in it.
And Slovenia is not.
But there is this Corporation at a European level also on policy.
Instruments it is on green public procurement on waste and recycling management and on the export position of SMS.
So European cooperation is helping governments to bring forward and and partner team up with SMS too.
To bring equal innovation and resource efficiency forwards.
Will do pilot actions.
Initiates or develop recommendations for best practices and joint innove.
Programs.
What I was saying is government needs to do its role.
It's a new role.
We are not doing as a regulator, but we are doing as a facilitator of new partnerships.
Thank you.
